analyzed: mjug ni gtsor ldog pa gcig pa gtso bo nyid kyi phyir bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //

analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes ni gang bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa gnyis las grol ba /

original: snying rje dang shes rab gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: snying rje dang shes rab gnyis su med pa /

original: chos kyi dbyings khong du chud pa rdzogs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings khong du chud pa rdzogs pa /

translated: It is born from the culmination of the perfect meditation on the meaning of reality, which is the perfection of abandonment and realization. It is the clear appearance.

analyzed: yang dag pa'i don can nyid kyis na mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin la rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid kyis na mngon sum ste nye bar mkho ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bcom ldan 'das so // me long lta bu'i ye shes ni gang la mtha' yas pa'i khams gsum pa'i sems dang cig shos kyi dngos po thams cad rdul phra rab so so ba ji ltar thag ring ba dang cig shos kyis yul dang 'das pa dang ; ma 'ongs pa dang /
translated: It is a valid cognition because it is non-deceptive, since it has the correct meaning, and it is direct perception because it is free from conceptual thought and is non-erroneous.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus bzhin gnas skabs so so ba me long la gzugs brnyan bzhin du gsal bar so sor snang ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus bzhin gnas skabs so so ba me long la gzugs brnyan bzhin du gsal bar so sor snang ba'o //
translated: The mirror-like wisdom is that in which all things, the minds of the infinite three realms and all other things, appear clearly and distinctly, like reflections in a mirror, in their individual particularities, whether distant or near, past, present or future.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni gang gi de ltar gzugs brnyan gyi 'gro ba rnams chos kyi bdag med pa nyid du mnyam pa nyid du rtogs nas sems can thams cad la rtag tu bdag nyid dang mnyam pa'i sems thob pa'o //

translated: The wisdom of equality is that, having realized that the beings of the reflected images are equal in the selflessness of phenomena, one always attains the thought of equality toward all sentient beings.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni gang gis de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa kho na'i bcom ldan 'das rtog pa med kyang rang gi sngon gyi smon lam dang sems can gyi bsod nams kyi dbang las sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod @222b pa rnams soğŸ”½sor rtogs par mdzad pa'o //

translated: The wisdom of individual knowledge is that, although the Bhagavat is not conceptual in that way, he individually knows the thoughts and conduct of all sentient beings through the power of his previous aspiration and the merit of sentient beings.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni gang gis de ltar so sor rtog pa'i 'gro ba'i bya ba rjes su sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni gang gis de ltar so sor rtog pa'i 'gro ba'i bya ba rjes su sgrub pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of accomplishing activities is that, having individually known in that way, one accomplishes the activities of sentient beings.

original: ye shes bzhi po 'di yang rtog pa phun sum tshogs pa ste de lta kho nar mngon sum dang thams cad mkhyen pa dang bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi po 'di yang rtog pa phun sum tshogs pa ste de lta kho nar mngon sum dang thams cad mkhyen pa dang bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: These four wisdoms are the perfection of conceptualization, and they are direct perception, omniscience, and the Bhagavat.

analyzed: ye shes lnga rnams kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de de yang mngon sum mo //
translated: The five exalted wisdoms are also the exalted knower of all aspects, and that is direct perception.

original: de skad du yang zla ba grags pas /
analyzed: de skad du yang zla ba grags pas /
translated: CandrakÄ«rti says this:

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen ye shes ni //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen ye shes ni //
translated: The exalted wisdom that knows all aspects

original: mngon sum mtshan nyid can du 'dod //ğŸ”½gzhan ni nyi tshe ba nyid kyis //
analyzed: mngon sum mtshan nyid can du 'dod // gzhan ni nyi tshe ba nyid kyis //
translated: is asserted to have the character of direct perception.ğŸ”½The others are not asserted to be direct perception

analyzed: de las ci ltar 'gyur na tha dad na ni shes pa'i rgyun lnga rnams su 'gyur la /

translated: If that were the case, when there are five continua of consciousness, sentient beings who were previously established would simultaneously attain the bodies of the five buddhas, just like the continua of consciousness of other bodies.

analyzed: de ltar ma yin te ye shes lnga po rnams ni phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos /

original: gzugs dang ro dang dri dang reg bya'i rdul phra rab kyi rgyun rnams la bum pa gcig tu gdags pa bzhin du tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i 'brel pa las dbyer med pa'i 'jug pa nyid kyis sems can gcig tu gdags pa'i yul kho na'o //

translated: Just as a continuum of subtle particles of form, taste, smell, and touch is designated as a single vase, they are only the object designated as a single sentient being by the connection of dependence on a single collection.

analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gzhan lus la med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it that there is no other continuum of consciousness dependent on a single collection in another body.

original: de'i tshe ye shes lnga bzhin du stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dpag tu med pa mtha' yas pa rnams so so rang rgyud tha dad pa nyid kyis na cig car sems kyi rgyun grangs med par 'gyur ro zhe na /

translated: At that time, just as with the five pristine wisdoms, the limitless, infinite pristine wisdom of the Buddha, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses, would be a separate continuum for each one, and so there would be an innumerable number of mind-continua simultaneously.

original: 'gyur mod skyon cung zad kyang med de /

analyzed: mos pa gcig gi yul gyur cing //

analyzed: 'bras bu gcig la nyer mkho ba //

analyzed: dbye ba med par 'jug rnams la //

analyzed: blo gcig kun gyi yul can gnas //

analyzed: zhes pa rigs pa'o //

translated: Well then, if the wisdoms of the transcendent conquerors are each divided into countless and distinct aspects, then there will not be even an atomâ€™s worth of anything left, because there will be no possibility of even a subtle particle.

analyzed: ye shes gcig bo de yang cung zad kyang ma lus pa med do //

analyzed: de ltar gyur na /

analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin tha mi dad pa yang ma yin gnyis ka ma yin no zhes pa ci zhig de kho na nyid du 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: ces so // gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes can rnams kyi ye shes lnga la sogs pa rnams la la lar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par tha snyad byed pa de ni gdul bya'i bsam pa'i ngor sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa'i shugs las so zhes
translated: And whatever is said about the five intuitions, etc. of those who have inconceivable intuition, that sometimes they are different and sometimes they are not different, is from the force of the projection of former vows in the face of the thought of those to be trained.

translated: Is there anything that is not attained through familiarization for three countless eons? Because it is the cause of freedom from the obscurations of attachment and so on.

analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po rnams ji lta ba bzhin du mthong gi /
translated: At that time, things are seen as they are.

analyzed: 'di las 'di dngos po ma lus par rtogs pa'i sprul pa la mkhas par rigs pa ma yin te de kho na nyid sgrib par byed pa nyid ni dri ma nyid yin la /
translated: It is not logical that the skill in emanation that comprehends all things is emanated by suchness, because the obscuration of suchness is itself a stain.

analyzed: dri ma nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par rtog pas sprul pa la gegs byed pa po ma yin no zhe na /

original: 'di la brtsad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brtsad par bya ste /

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dang bral ba yang nyon mongs pa med par ma yin te / gang gi tshe dga' ba'i dngos po mthong ba na skyon dang mthong ba la yang skyon med par rtog pa de'i tshe 'dod chags ni gsal bar rgyu yin no //
translated: And also, the absence of afflictions is not due to the absence of that conceptual thought.ğŸ”½When one sees a pleasant thing, and conceptualizes it as faultless, then attachment clearly arises.

analyzed: gang gi tshe yang mi dga' ba yon tan dang ldan pa yang yon tan med par rnam par rtog pa de'i tshe zhe sdang ngo //
translated: When one sees an unpleasant thing, and conceptualizes it as having no good qualities, then aversion arises.

analyzed: gang de lta bu'i bsod nams kyi phung po rnam @240b par smin pa sems can rnams kho na'i yin par dga' bar byed kyi bdag nyid lam yin zhing sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub
translated: One should rejoice in the maturation of that mass of merit for sentient beings alone, not for oneself, and dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu dga' ba'i sa la yang ting nge 'dzin rnam grangs med pa nyid na yang rmi lam gyi gnas skabs bzhin dus de srid par snang pa'o zhes pa'i cha ni seng ge bzang po'i cha yin la gang yang rtogs pa'i tshul gyis brtan

analyzed: nyid du de'i tshe kho nar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir bsam pa de ni legs pa ma yin no //

translated: Even if it were the case that the bodhisattva manifests all the meditative states and formless states of composure at all times through his skill in means, still, the stains that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation would not be completely eliminated at that time because they are not completely clear and because they are not completely pervaded by the path.

original: de ltar dpag tu med pa'i yon tan gyi gter byang chub sems dpa' de ni phal cher 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang phyug tu 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi bar 'dzin pa sngon ma can nyid kyis na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ni rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu kho nar 'gyur la chos thams cad sgyu ma ltar bsgom pas ni sems can gdul ba rgyur byas

analyzed: mdo sde rgyan la sogs pa rnams su gsungs pa /

analyzed: 'gyur zhing skye ba thams cad du //

analyzed: sems 'thob pa yang yin /

analyzed: de ltar yongs su sbyong ba'i sa bdun rnams dang 'bad pa dang bcas pas mtshan ma med par spyod pa'i yon tan rnams rtogs pa las sems bskyed pa bcu gnyis pa smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra

analyzed: khyad par gang yin sangs rgyas dang// byang chub sems dpa'i khyad de yin //

analyzed: zhes so // de ltar 'di'i yon tan rnams mdor bsdus pa bstan pa ste /

analyzed: rgyas par ni bskal pa grangs med pa 'bum phrag du mas kyang mthar thug pa med pa'i rnam pas blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: kyi sprin 'di kho na bskal pa tshad med par bstan kyang phyogs tsam zhig bstan par zad na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa lta ci smos /

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras de gal te phyogs bcu rnams su phyogs re rer 'jig rten gyi khams mu med pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams 'di lta bu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gang bar gyur kyang /

analyzed: de rnams kyis bskal pa mtha' yas par bsgrubs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par bsgrubs pas ni /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes skad cig gcig las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gyi yang ji skad bye ba khrag khri 'bum gyi cha dang grangs dang / rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes skad cig gcig las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul gyi yang ji skad bye ba khrag khri 'bum gyi cha dang grangs dang / rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do zhes so //

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di sa bcu pa 'di kho na'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par bco lnga pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa drug rnams mngon par sgrub po //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di sa bcu pa 'di kho na'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par bco lnga pa la sogs pa sems bskyed pa drug rnams mngon par sgrub po //

analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa bco lnga pa mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni rgyal po chen po lta bu ste /

analyzed: mthu thogs pa med pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa /
translated: As the Blessed Lady says,

original: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho chen po la sogs pa'i chu'i phung po gang de thams cad skra'i rtse mo'i mtha' brgyar gshags pa'i chas 'phen par byed la de la brten pa'i srog chags rnams la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya mtsho chen po la sogs pa'i chu'i phung po gang de thams cad skra'i rtse mo'i mtha' brgyar gshags pa'i chas 'phen par byed la de la brten pa'i srog chags rnams la gnod pa med do //
translated: He can take all the water in the great oceans of the trichiliocosm and so forth and put it on the tip of a fingernail split a hundredth of the tip of a hair, and the creatures living in that water are not harmed.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bskal par bsregs pa'i me 'bar ba kha'i dbugs kyis rab tu zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bskal par bsregs pa'i me 'bar ba kha'i dbugs kyis rab tu zhi bar byed do //

translated: He can stop with the tip of one toe a great wind mandala that pervades all world systems and shakes them.

original: nam mkha'i khams skyil mo krung gcig gis khyab par byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams skyil mo krung gcig gis khyab par byed do //
translated: He can pervade the realm of space with a single cross-legged posture.

original: ri rab chen po la sogs pa'i ri bo rnams skra nyag ma gcig gis bcings te 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: ri rab chen po la sogs pa'i ri bo rnams skra nyag ma gcig gis bcings te 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med par 'phen par byed do //
translated: He binds together the great Mount Meru and the other mountains with a single hair, and hurls them into the immeasurable world-realms.

original: phyogs bcu rnams su so sor sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du @259b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams lha'i mig gis blta'o //

original: de rnams kyi chos bstan pa yang lha'i rna bas nyan no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi chos bstan pa yang lha'i rna bas nyan no //
translated: He hears the teachings of those Buddhas with the divine ear.

original: sems can rnams kyi sems dang spyod pa rnams shes so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems dang spyod pa rnams shes so //

original: de rnams kyi yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran no //

original: zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub la /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub la /

analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' sngon du byed pa yang ma yin no zhes so //

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa la sogs pa'i mthu 'di 'dra ba yang dad par dka' ba ma yin te /

analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams kyi yang dag par ston pa khyab bdag nyid 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //

original: sems bskyed pa 'di ni ston pa mi zad pa yang ngo //ğŸ”½de la don la rton gyi legs par sbyar ba la sogs pa'i tshig 'bru la ma yin pa dang / chos ni rigs pa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa 'di ni ston pa mi zad pa yang ngo // de la don la rton gyi legs par sbyar ba la sogs pa'i tshig 'bru la ma yin pa dang / chos ni rigs pa ste /
translated: This generation of the Thought is also the inexhaustible teaching.ğŸ”½Therein, one relies on the meaning, not on the letter, such as the well-formed words.

original: de la rton gyi gnas brtan la sogs pa'i gang zag la ma yin pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni ye shes te /
analyzed: de la rton gyi gnas brtan la sogs pa'i gang zag la ma yin pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni ye shes te /

analyzed: sems bskyed pa bcu drug la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang ldan pa ni bang mdzod lta bu ste /

analyzed: sems bskyed pa bco brgyad pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni bzhon pa lta bu ste de zung du 'brel par 'gro ba nyid kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung bar mi ltung bar bde blag tu 'gro ba'i phyir ro

translated: The nineteenth generation of bodhichitta, endowed with retention and eloquence, is like the water of a fountain, because it is similar to a water-bearing cloud, which holds water and releases it inexhaustibly, in that it holds the Dharma and its meaning, both heard and not heard, and releases them inexhaustibly in teaching.

analyzed: sgra lta bu ste thar pa 'dod pa'i gdul bya rnams la snyan par sgrogs pa'i phyir //

analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das mar gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Bhagavatiprajnaparamita:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phyogs bcu so sor dus ring por mun pas 'thoms pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar rnams lus kyi 'od kyis snang bar byas nas der skyes pa'i sems can rnams sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang chos kyi sgra dang dge 'dun gyi sgra sgrogs par byed cing

analyzed: de la mi rtag pa ni rtag tu med pa ste /

analyzed: kun rdzob tu skad cig gis 'jig pa'i don yang mi rtag pa'i don no //
translated: The meaning of momentary destruction in the conventional sense is also the meaning of impermanence.ğŸ”½Peace is the complete pacification of all conceptualization.ğŸ”½This is the summary.

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba ni zhi ba'o zhes pa mdor bsdus te sa'i yon tan rnam par gzhag pa ste /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnams te /
translated: â€œO son of the victors, these are the ten bodhisattva stages.

translated: The teaching is concise, but it should be understood from the blessing of teaching extensively for endless eons.

translated: Those that have been taught, will be taught, and are being taught by the BhagavÄn Buddhas of the past, future, and present, O children of the Victor, are the ten bodhisattva stages.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su song ba rnams su blta bar bya ste /
translated: They should be seen as following the wisdom of omniscience,

analyzed: rim gyis mngon du phyogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes so //
translated: because they gradually approach it.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang skad cig gcig kho na la bcom ldan 'das kyis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang skad cig gcig kho na la bcom ldan 'das kyis rtogs pa ste /
translated: That omniscient wisdom is realized by the BhagavÄn in a single moment.

analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa tha dad na yang /
translated: Just as, for example, although pots, etc. are different,

translated: they are the same in being non-obstructing.

translated: Just as the space that reaches there is not different, in the same way, although things such as form and feeling are different, the reality that reaches there is not different, because it has the characteristic of non-arising.

original: shes par bya zhing /
analyzed: shes par bya zhing /

analyzed: de yang shes pa'i @260b skad cig gcig kho nas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is realized by only one moment of consciousness.

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de yang sems bskyed pa gnyis te ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: That gnosis of omniscience is also of the nature of two arousals of bodhicitta and five gnoses.

analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gcig pa bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa ste /
translated: There, the twenty-one arousals of bodhicitta possess the path of single progress.

original: bla na med pa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas na sa de pa rnams byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo'i sems de'i bdag nyid du sbyor ba las byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu dang bya ba dang

translated: Since they have attained the acceptance that phenomena are unborn, on this spiritual level the bodhisattvas are connected to the mind that is the essence of enlightenment.

analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam mo //
translated: Because the result, the activity, and the essence of enlightenment are not different for the bodhisattvas, this is the path of the single way.

analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni chu'i rgyun lta bu ste rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

translated: The path of the single way is from the stage of Immovable onward, because of its mixture and close mixture.

original: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa chos kyi sku dang ldan pa'i sprin lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa chos kyi sku dang ldan pa'i sprin lta bu ste /
translated: The twenty-second generation of the mind is like a cloud, endowed with the Dharma body,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba rnams de las 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba rnams de las 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: because all the activities for the benefit of all sentient beings emerge from it.

original: sprin las snod kyi 'jig rten phun sum tshogs pa rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: sprin las snod kyi 'jig rten phun sum tshogs pa rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as the world of the environment is perfect from the clouds.

original: thabs la mkhas pa mi zad pa yang dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa mi zad pa yang dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa kun du ston pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in means is the display of the Bodhisattva's life in the Tusita heaven, etc.

original: de ltar yang bstan bcos kyang //
analyzed: de ltar yang bstan bcos kyang //
translated: The treatise declares:

original: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste //
translated: The perfect realization of all aspects

original: 'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin //
translated: is endowed with skill in means.

original: zhes so // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The Acarya Vasubandhu also says:

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni rnam par thar pa dang thabs la mkhas pa'i phrin las can te /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni rnam par thar pa dang thabs la mkhas pa'i phrin las can te /
translated: The Buddha's knowledge of the turning of the wheel of the Dharma is endowed with the activity of liberation and skill in means,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar cig car chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i phyir ro zhes so //ğŸ”½thabs la mkhas pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po dag gam /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar cig car chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i phyir ro zhes so // thabs la mkhas pa ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje chen po dag gam /
translated: because it turns the wheel of the Dharma simultaneously in a hundred million Jambudvipas.

original: de las skyes pa'i las la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i las la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in means is skill in emptiness and great compassion, or skill in the action born from them.

original: ci'i phyir dga' ldan du bzhugs pa kun du ston gyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams su ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dga' ldan du bzhugs pa kun du ston gyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams su ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why does he manifest his stay in Tuá¹£ita and not in the form and formless realms?

original: mi khom pa nas 'dir 'ongs pa bdag cag gi rgyu mtshan du ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes rim gro mang du mi byed pa yongs su spong ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: mi khom pa nas 'dir 'ongs pa bdag cag gi rgyu mtshan du ni ma yin pa kho na'o zhes rim gro mang du mi byed pa yongs su spong ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to avoid the idea that he came here from an uncomfortable place, and in order to avoid the idea that he did not come from a cause.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan 'phrul dbang byed du ma yin zhe na /ğŸ”½nus pa yod kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'i skye ba spangs nas sems can la thugs brtse bas dga' ldan du skyes so zhes rim gro mang du lhag par bskyed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan 'phrul dbang byed du ma yin zhe na / nus pa yod kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'i skye ba spangs nas sems can la thugs brtse bas dga' ldan du skyes so zhes rim gro mang du lhag par bskyed pa'i don du'o //
translated: Why not in Paranirmita-vaÅ›a-vartin?

original: ci'i phyir @261a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir @261a * //
translated: In order to generate even more respect, since he was born in Tuá¹£ita out of compassion for sentient beings, having abandoned a superior birth, even though he was capable of it.

original: mi rnams su ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi rnams su ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why not among humans?

original: lha'i bde ba spangs nas bdag cag la thugs brtse bas mir byon no zhes rim gro mang du lhag par bskyed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: lha'i bde ba spangs nas bdag cag la thugs brtse bas mir byon no zhes rim gro mang du lhag par bskyed pa'i don du'o //
translated: In order to generate even more respect, since he came to the human realm out of compassion for us, having abandoned the bliss of the gods.

original: ci'i phyir mngal du gnas pa ston zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mngal du gnas pa ston zhe na /
translated: Why does he manifest his stay in the womb?

original: rigs mthun pa spro ba bskyed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa spro ba bskyed pa'i don du'o //
translated: In order to delight those of similar type.

original: ci'i phyir rang nyid mngon par byang chub pa bstan gyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang nyid mngon par byang chub pa bstan gyi /
translated: Why did he demonstrate his own enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas gzhan gyi nye bar bstan pa ma yin zhe na //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan gyi nye bar bstan pa ma yin zhe na //
translated: but not the manifestation of other Buddhas?

original: skyes bu'i byed pa la sbyor ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa la sbyor ba'i don du ste /
translated: In order to apply himself to the activity of a person,

original: gzhan la rag las pas mi 'grub ces pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pas mi 'grub ces pa'o //
translated: since it is not accomplished by dependence on another.

original: ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gnas pas gnas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gnas pas gnas she na /
translated: Why did he abide in the state of dependent origination?

original: de mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa thun mong ma yin par gsal bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa thun mong ma yin par gsal bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to clarify his own uncommon realization of that.

original: ci'i don du gzhan gyi don du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyi ma bdun du 'das par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i don du gzhan gyi don du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyi ma bdun du 'das par mdzad ce na /
translated: For what purpose did he manifest perfect enlightenment for the sake of others, and then pass into final cessation after seven days?

original: bdag nyid chos kyi kun dga' dgyes pa chen po nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid chos kyi kun dga' dgyes pa chen po nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to clarify his own great delight and joy in the Dharma.

original: de yang ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: And for what purpose?

original: sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa dga' ba dang gus pa yang dag par 'phel ba'i don du ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa dga' ba dang gus pa yang dag par 'phel ba'i don du ste /
translated: In order to increase the delight and respect of sentient beings for the Tathagata.

original: da ltar gyur kyang de 'dra ba'i dgyes pa spangs nas sems can rnams la thugs brtse bas chos ston par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyur kyang de 'dra ba'i dgyes pa spangs nas sems can rnams la thugs brtse bas chos ston par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: Even now, having abandoned such delight, he teaches the Dharma out of his compassion for sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir cang mi gsung bar gyur ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir cang mi gsung bar gyur ce na /
translated: Why did he remain silent?

original: yongs su skom pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pas chos la gus par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: yongs su skom pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pas chos la gus par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to generate respect for the Dharma, since those who are very thirsty are in no hurry.

original: de las tshangs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: de las tshangs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po la sogs pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: Here, the request was made by Brahma, the Bodhisattvas, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu gsol ba ma btab pa kho nar ston par rtsom zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu gsol ba ma btab pa kho nar ston par rtsom zhe na /
translated: Why did he begin to teach without being requested to do so?

original: gzhan du na ci ston par bzhed pa'am zhes 'di'i ston par bzhed pa nyid mi shes pas so //
analyzed: gzhan du na ci ston par bzhed pa'am zhes 'di'i ston par bzhed pa nyid mi shes pas so //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be known that he was willing to teach.

original: cis yang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la bstan pa'i ched du byin gyis rlob par byed ce na /
analyzed: cis yang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la bstan pa'i ched du byin gyis rlob par byed ce na /
translated: Why did he bless the Bodhisattvas and so on in order to teach?

original: de'i rigs rnams spro ba yang dag par 'phel ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs rnams spro ba yang dag par 'phel ba'i don du'o //
translated: In order to increase the enthusiasm of those of his spiritual family.

original: byin gyis rlob pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Blessing is of three kinds:

original: sku'i phyag gis reg pa las sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i phyag gis reg pa las sogs pa'o //
translated: and the Buddha touched him with his hand.
